definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: milk (NH id. (and vb. denom.); Aram. [[חַלָבָּא]], h.albo0, Ph. [[חלב]]; Ar. h.aliybun n. fresh milk, h.alaba vb. milk; As. alibu, milk, v. Dl:Pr 174; Eth. h.aleb:)—´[[ח]] abs. Ge 18:18 + 35 t. + Ez Eze 34:3 (v. infr.); cstr. [[חֲלֵב]] Ex 23:19 + 5 t.; sf. [[חֲלָבִי]] Ct So 5:1, [[חֲלָבֵח]] Ez Eze 25:4; —milk:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: as common food Ge 18:8 (J; distinct from [[חֶמְאָה]] curd, q.v.), [[חֲלֵב חאׁן]] De 32:14 (poet.; distinct fr. [[חֶמְאַת בָּקָר]]); in Ju Jdg 5:25 [[חָלָב]] is used parallel with [[חֶמְאָה]]; elsewhere [[חֶמְאָה]] seems to be produced fr. [[חָלָב]]:—[[מִיץ חָלָב יוֹחִיא חֶמְאָה]] Pr 30:33 a pressing (squeezing) of milk produces curd; [[מֵרׂב]] [[עֲשׂוֹת חָלָב יאׁכַל חֶמְאָה]] Is 7:22 because of abundant yield of milk he shall eat curd; cf. also [[חֲרִחֵי]] [[הֶחָלָב]] 1Sa 17:18 cuts of milk, i.e. cheeses; it was received in buckets or pails ([[עֲטִינׇיו]]) Job 21:24 (v. Ew De Di VB), and kept in skins (´[[נזׁוד ח]]) Ju Jdg 4:19; men drank it ([[שׁתה]]) Ez Eze 25:4 (cf. [[השׁקה]] Ju Jdg 4:19), but also ate it ([[אכל]]), if emend. [[הֶחָלָב]] Ez Eze 34:3 (for [[הַחֵלֶב]]) is right, LXX Vulgate Bo Hi-Sm Co, al.; it was poured out, v. sim. of formation of the embryo [[תַּתִּיכֵנִי]] ´[[הֲלאׁ כֶח]] Job 10:10 hast thou not poured me out like milk? specif. (1) [[חֲלֵב עִזִּים לְלַחְמְךָ]] Pr 27:27 milk of goats for thy food (RS:Sem. i. 204). (2) c. [[אֵם]] mother's milk: of kid [[לאׁ־תְבַשֵּׁל גְּדִי בַּחֲלֵב אִמּוֹ]] Ex 23:19 = Ex 34:26 (JE) = De 14:21, cf. ´[[טְלֵה ח]] 1Sa 7:9 sucking lamb (for sacrif.); but also of human beings ´[[גְּמוּלֵי מֵח]] Is 28:9 weaned from milk (‖[[עַתִּיקֵי מִשָּׁדָ֫יִם]]); fig. in promise to Zion [[וְיׇנַקְתְּ חֲלֵב גּוֹיִם]] Is 60:16 and thou shalt suck the milk of nations (‖[[תִּינָ֑קִי וְשׁׂד מְלָכִים]]). (3) ´[[ח]] with wine, as esp. delicacy Ct So 5:1 (v. De), fig. of ´[[י]]'s choicest blessings Is 55:1. (4) oft. in phr. of productiveness of land of Canaan ([[דְּבַשׁ]]) [[זׇבַת חָלָב וּדְבָ֫שׁ]] flowing with milk and honey Ex 3:8, Ex 3:17, Ex 13:5, Ex 33:3, Nu 13:27, Nu 14:8, Nu 16:13, Nu 16:14 (all JE), Le 20:24 (H), De 6:3, De 11:9, De 26:9, De 26:15, De 27:3, De 31:20, Jos 5:6, Je 11:5, Je 32:22, Ez Eze 20:6, Eze 20:15; in Messian. time the hills ´[[תֵּלַכְנׇה ח]] Joe 4:18 (‖[[יִטְּפוּ הֶהָרִים עָסִיס]]); fig. of charms of loved one [[תַּחַת לְשׁוֹנֵח]] ´[[דְּבַשׁ וְח]] Ct So 4:12 honey and milk are under thy tongue.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: milk as white ´[[לְבֶן־שִׁנַּיִם מֵח]] Ge 49:12 white of teeth, from milk; ´[[חַחוּ מֵח]] La 4:7 they were whiter than milk (‖[[זַכּוּ מִשֶּׁלֶג]]); so also prob. of eyes (iris) ´[[רׂחֲחוֹת בֶּח]] Ct So 5:12 bathed in milk, i.e. the white of the eye.—On milk as not used by Israel in sacrifice v. RS:Sem. 204.
